Interface com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.ISettings
Inherited members: ShowHide
Deprecated: ShowHide
com.penthera.virtuososdk.client

Interface ISettings

  • public interface ISettings
    Provides access to the settings which can be configured by the client. The Settings can be accessed through the getSettings call in Virtuoso. Modified settings are only applied once you call save. This allows you to chain modifications together and have the changes persisted in one operation, e.g: 
     
     ISettings settings = Virtuoso.getSettings().setHeadroom(1024).setMaxStorageAllowed(10240).save();

    Applications can listen for changes to these configuration values by implementing the settingChanged method in Observers.IEngineObserver. Flags reported through that API are detailed in: SettingFlag
    • Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      MINIMUM_HEADROOM 
      static long MINIMUM_HEADROOM
      The minimum headroom required by the SDK.
      static final long MINIMUM_HEADROOM
      The minimum headroom required by the SDK. Attempts to set values below this will result in the minimum value being applied instead.
      See Also:

        getAudioCodecsToDownload 
        abstract java.lang.String[] getAudioCodecsToDownload()

        Returns:

        getBatteryThreshold 
        abstract float getBatteryThreshold()
        Current effective value for battery threshold.
        float getBatteryThreshold()
        Current effective value for battery threshold.
        Acceptable values are [0,1], where 0 means 'always download' and 1 means 'download only while charging'. Virtuoso will download only if the battery charge exceeds this value, or if the device is charging and the battery charge is greater than 10%. The default value is 0.5 (50%).
        Returns:
        Current battery threshold, in the range [0,1]
        getCellularDataQuota 
        abstract long getCellularDataQuota()
        Current effective value for cellular data quota.
        long getCellularDataQuota()
        Current effective value for cellular data quota.
        This is the maximum amount of cellular data Virtuoso can use for downloading per week on this device. The default value is 100 MB.
        Returns:
        Current cell quota in MB. A negative value indicates no limit.

        abstract long getMaxStorageAllowed()
        Current effective value for max storage allowed.
        long getMaxStorageAllowed()

        getProgressUpdateByPercent 
        abstract int getProgressUpdateByPercent()
        Current value for the frequency of progress updates based on a percent interval.
        int getProgressUpdateByPercent()
        Current value for the frequency of progress updates based on a percent interval. Note that when progress updates have been configured for multiple boundaries, the update will occur on the next boundary.
        Returns:
        The percentage boundary upon which a notification should occur. i.e.: If this value is reported as 3 a progress update notification will occur each time 3% of the asset has been downloaded.
        getProgressUpdateByTime 
        abstract long getProgressUpdateByTime()
        Current value for the frequency of progress updates based on elapsed time interval.
        long getProgressUpdateByTime()
        Current value for the frequency of progress updates based on elapsed time interval. Note that when progress updates have been configured for multiple boundaries, the update will occur on the next boundary.
        Returns:
        The minimum amount of time in milliseconds that must pass before a notification occurs.

        int getProgressUpdatesPerSegment()
        Current value for the frequency of progress updates based on the number of segments downloaded in a Segmented Asset. Note that when progress updates have been configured for multiple boundaries, the update will occur on the next boundary.
        Returns:
        The segment downloaded boundary upon which a notification should occur.

        Resets the cellular data quota start to be the current time and zeroes out the current cell usage.

        Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the settingChanged method in Observers.IEngineObserver. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_QUOTA_START_DATE
        Returns:
        The effective settings without the modification having been persisted.

        save 
        abstract ISettings save()
        Save any modifications to the settings.
        ISettings save()
        Save any modifications to the settings. Calling this method will result in all changes being persisted. Clients can receive notifications on which setting has been changed through the settingChanged callback in IEngineObserver
        Returns:
        A Saved version of the current settings.
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver
        setAlwaysRequestPermission 
        abstract ISettings setAlwaysRequestPermission(boolean aValue)
        Always request permission.
        ISettings setAlwaysRequestPermission(boolean aValue)
        Always request permission.
        Normally, the download engine only checks for download permissions when it knows there is a limit configured such as Max downloader per Account or Max Downloads per Asset. Setting this to true will cause the engine to always check permissions with the backplane even when no limits are configured on the device.
        Parameters:
        aValue - True to require permissions checks at all times. Default value is false.
        Returns:
        The effective settings without the modification having been persisted.

        Returns:

        setBatteryThreshold 
        abstract ISettings setBatteryThreshold(float aThreshold)
        Change the setting for battery threshold.
        ISettings setBatteryThreshold(float aThreshold)
        Change the setting for battery threshold.
        The new setting is only applied once you call save.
        If the new value differs from the current setting, then a callback is made to settingChanged callback in IEngineObserver

        Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the settingChanged. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_BATTERY_THRESHOLD
        Parameters:
        aThreshold - New threshold to be applied. Allowable values are [0..1].
        Returns:
        The effective settings without the modification having been persisted.
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver
        setCellularDataQuota 
        abstract ISettings setCellularDataQuota(long aQuota)
        Change the setting for cellular quota.
        ISettings setCellularDataQuota(long aQuota)
        Change the setting for cellular quota.
        The new setting is only applied once you call save.
        If the new value differs from the current setting, then a callback is made to settingChanged callback in IEngineObserver Setting the Cellular Data Quota to a negative value indicates no limitations.

        Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the settingChanged. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_QUOTA
        Parameters:
        aQuota - New cell quota to be applied, in MB.
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver
        setDestinationPath 
        abstract ISettings setDestinationPath(java.lang.String aBasePath)
        Change the setting for destination path.
        ISettings setDestinationPath(java.lang.String aBasePath)
        Change the setting for destination path.
        The new setting is only applied once you call save.
        This setting is relative to the root directory of the application. Any path supplied here will be appended to the root path. If the new value differs from the current setting, then a callback is made to settingChanged callback in IEngineObserver

        Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the settingChanged. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_DESTINATION_PATH
        Parameters:
        aBasePath - New base path to be used to store downloaded assets
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver
        setGlobalRequestHeaders 
        abstract ISettings setGlobalRequestHeaders(Bundle aHeaders)
        With this method, clients can configure the HTTP headers Virtuoso uses when making GET requests to download remote assets.
        ISettings setGlobalRequestHeaders(Bundle aHeaders)
        With this method, clients can configure the HTTP headers Virtuoso uses when making GET requests to download remote assets. The caller can add HTTP headers to be sent with all download requests.

        Applications can listen for changes to these configuration values by implementing the settingChanged method in Observers.IEngineObserver. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_GLOBAL_HTTP_HEADERS
        Parameters:
        aHeaders - Custom HTTP headers bundle specifying the global headers to be applied on every download (key/value pairs).
        Returns:
        The effective settings without the modification having been persisted.
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver.settingChanged(int)

        setMaxDownloadConnections 
        abstract ISettings setMaxDownloadConnections(int aMax)
        Sets the max permissible concurrent network connections in the downloader.
        ISettings setMaxDownloadConnections(int aMax)
        Sets the max permissible concurrent network connections in the downloader. This rule dictates the maximum number of connections. A lower number of connections may be used based upon the hardware. Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the settingChanged method in Observers.IEngineObserver. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_MAX_DOWNLOAD_CONNECTIONS
        Parameters:
        aMax - New maximum value. If this value is <=0 then it will be interpreted as Integer.MAX_VALUE
        Returns:
        The effective settings without the modification having been persisted.
        setMaxPermittedSegmentErrors 
        abstract ISettings setMaxPermittedSegmentErrors(int max)
        Change the setting for max permissible download errors on segments.
        ISettings setMaxPermittedSegmentErrors(int max)
        Change the setting for max permissible download errors on segments.
        The new setting is only applied once you call save.
        If the new value differs from the current setting, then a callback is made to settingChanged callback in IEngineObserver Setting the value to negative is interpreted as zero. A zero indicates that the download should error on the first segment to fail 3 times.
        A value greater than zero means that downloads will proceed and complete even with errored segments; as long as there are no more than the specified value.
        Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the settingChanged listener. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_MAX_SEG_ERRORS
        Parameters:
        max - The new max value for permissible download errors.
        Returns:
        The effective settings without the modification having been persisted
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver
        setMaxStorageAllowed 
        abstract ISettings setMaxStorageAllowed(long aMaxStorage)
        Change the setting for max storage.
        ISettings setMaxStorageAllowed(long aMaxStorage)
        Change the setting for max storage.
        The new setting is only applied once you call save.
        If the new value differs from the current setting, then a callback is made to settingChanged callback in IEngineObserver Setting the Max Storage Allowed to a negative value indicates no storage limitations.

        Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the settingChanged listener. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_MAX_STORAGE
        Parameters:
        aMaxStorage - New max storage to be applied, in MB.
        Returns:
        The effective settings without the modification having been persisted.
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver
        setProgressUpdateByPercent 
        abstract ISettings setProgressUpdateByPercent(int aPercent)
        Configure the frequency of progress updates during a download.
        ISettings setProgressUpdateByPercent(int aPercent)
        Configure the frequency of progress updates during a download.

        While downloading, Virtuoso will report back updates through the Content Uri, the IQueueObserver or via Broadcasts. This method allows a caller to configure the frequency of those updates by the percent of asset downloaded.

        The setting value should range from 0 to 100. A value of 0 or less resets the progress update for percentage to the default of 1%. A value of 100 turns progress updates off at a percentage level.

        Applications can listen for changes to these configuration values by implementing the settingChanged method in Observers.IEngineObserver. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_PROGRESS_UPDATE_PERCENT

        Parameters:
        aPercent - The new value to use for configuring the update frequency.
        Returns:
        The effective settings without the modification having been persisted.
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver.settingChanged(int)
        setProgressUpdateByTime 
        abstract ISettings setProgressUpdateByTime(long aMilliseconds)
        Configure the frequency of progress updates during a download.
        ISettings setProgressUpdateByTime(long aMilliseconds)
        Configure the frequency of progress updates during a download.

        While downloading, Virtuoso will report back updates through the Content Uri, the IQueueObserver or via Broadcasts. This method allows a caller to configure the frequency of those updates by time elapsed during download.
        The setting represents the minimum amount of time (in ms) that Virtuoso should wait before performing a notification. The lowest permitted value is 1000. Setting a value of 999 or less will reset the update frequency to the default value of 5000. Setting a value of Long.MAX_VALUE will turn off updates on a timed basis.

        Applications can listen for changes to these configuration values by implementing the settingChanged method in Observers.IEngineObserver. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_PROGRESS_UPDATE_TIME

        Parameters:
        aMilliseconds - The new value to use for configuring the update frequency.
        Returns:
        The effective settings without the modification having been persisted.
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver.settingChanged(int)
        setProgressUpdatesPerSegment 
        abstract ISettings setProgressUpdatesPerSegment(int aNumberOfSegments)
        Configure the frequency of progress updates for Segmented Assets.
        ISettings setProgressUpdatesPerSegment(int aNumberOfSegments)
        Configure the frequency of progress updates for Segmented Assets.

        While downloading Segmented Assets, Virtuoso can also report back updates through the through the IQueueObserver. This method allows a caller to configure the frequency of those updates by number of Segments completing download.
        Setting a value of 0 or less will disable updates by Segment completion.

        Applications can listen for changes to these configuration values by implementing the settingChanged method in Observers.IEngineObserver. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_SEGMENT_RATE

        Parameters:
        aNumberOfSegments - The new value to use for configuring the update frequency.
        Returns:
        The effective settings without the modification having been persisted.
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver.settingChanged(int)
        setRemoveNotificationOnPause 
        abstract ISettings setRemoveNotificationOnPause(boolean remove)
        Sets the service to leave foreground mode and hide the notification when paused.
        ISettings setRemoveNotificationOnPause(boolean remove)
        Sets the service to leave foreground mode and hide the notification when paused. Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the settingChanged method in Observers.IEngineObserver. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_NOTIFICATION_ON_PAUSE
        Parameters:
        remove - Boolean indicating if notification should be hidden when downloads are paused.
        Returns:
        The effective settings without the modification have been persisted.
        setSegmentErrorHttpCode 
        abstract ISettings setSegmentErrorHttpCode(int code)
        Change the HTTP code that is returned by the proxy when segments (for assets that have completed) are missing or have errors.
        ISettings setSegmentErrorHttpCode(int code)
        Change the HTTP code that is returned by the proxy when segments (for assets that have completed) are missing or have errors. The default value is 200.

        Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the settingChanged listener. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_PROXY_HTTP_CODE
        Parameters:
        code - The new HTTP code that will be returned by the proxy.
        Returns:
        The effective settings without the modification having been persisted
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver
      • Configuring Subscriptions and Feeds 
        Modifier and Type Method and Description
        getCanAutoDeleteForSubscriptions 
        abstract boolean getCanAutoDeleteForSubscriptions()
        Current default value for the auto-delete rule on subscribed feeds
        This is the default value.
        boolean getCanAutoDeleteForSubscriptions()
        Current default value for the auto-delete rule on subscribed feeds
        This is the default value. To get the value for a particular feed, use the Virtuoso.getFeedCanDelete(java.lang.String) method.
        This rule applies when Virtuoso is already storing "max number of assets" for a feed and a new episode is available for download in that feed.
        Returns:
        True if Virtuoso will auto delete old episodes to make room for new episodes
        See Also:
        SubscriptionsService
        getMaxAssetsForSubscriptions 
        abstract int getMaxAssetsForSubscriptions()
        Global value for the "max number of assets" rule on subscription feeds.
        int getMaxAssetsForSubscriptions()
        Global value for the "max number of assets" rule on subscription feeds. This rule dictates the maximum number of assets which may be stored on a device in a subscribed feed. It is the global default and is applied if a feed does not have its own rule.
        To get the rule for an individual feed, use Virtuoso.getFeedMaxAssets(java.lang.String) method.
        Returns:
        Max subscribed assets
        See Also:
        SubscriptionsService
        getMaxBitrateForSubscriptions 
        abstract int getMaxBitrateForSubscriptions()
        Current default value for the "max bitrate" rule on subscription feeds.
        int getMaxBitrateForSubscriptions()
        Current default value for the "max bitrate" rule on subscription feeds.
        This rule is only used with segmented videos. It tells Virtuoso the max bitrate to use when choosing a profile for download.
        To get the maximum bit rate for particular feed, use the Virtuoso.getFeedMaxBitRate(java.lang.String) method.
        Returns:
        Maximum bit rate for the feed, or -1 if it has not been overridden
        See Also:
        SubscriptionsService
        resetCanAutoDeleteForSubscriptions 
        abstract ISettings resetCanAutoDeleteForSubscriptions()
        Reset default value for the auto-delete rule on subscribed feeds to True.
        ISettings resetCanAutoDeleteForSubscriptions()

        Returns:
        The effective settings without the modification having been persisted.
        See Also:
        SubscriptionsService

        Returns:
        The effective settings without the modification having been persisted.
        See Also:
        SubscriptionsService
        resetMaxBitrateForSubscriptions

        ISettings resetMaxBitrateForSubscriptions()
        Reset default value for the "max bitrate" rule on subscribed feeds to -1.
        Returns:
        The effective settings without the modification having been persisted.
        See Also:
        SubscriptionsService
        setCanAutoDeleteForSubscriptions 
        abstract ISettings setCanAutoDeleteForSubscriptions(boolean aAutoDelete)
        Set the default auto-delete rule for subscribed feeds.
        ISettings setCanAutoDeleteForSubscriptions(boolean aAutoDelete)
        Set the default auto-delete rule for subscribed feeds. Virtuoso uses this rule when a feed does not have an auto-delete property of its own.
        To assign auto-delete properties on a per feed basis, use the Virtuoso.setFeedCanDelete(java.lang.String, boolean) method.
        The auto-delete rule dictates whether Virtuoso will delete old episodes to make room for new ones.

        This rule applies when Virtuoso is already storing "max number of items" for a feed and a new episode is available for download in that feed.

        Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the settingChanged method in Observers.IEngineObserver. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_SUBSCRIPTIONS_CAN_AUTO_DELETE
        Parameters:
        aAutoDelete - True, if Virtuoso should auto delete old episodes in a feed to make room for new episodes
        Returns:
        The effective settings without the modification having been persisted.
        See Also:
        SubscriptionsService
        setMaxAssetsForSubscriptions 
        abstract ISettings setMaxAssetsForSubscriptions(int aMax)
        Sets global value for the "max number of assets" rule on subscription feeds.
        ISettings setMaxAssetsForSubscriptions(int aMax)
        Sets global value for the "max number of assets" rule on subscription feeds. This rule dictates the maximum number of episodes which may be stored on a device in a subscribed feed. It is the global default and is applied if a feed does not have its own rule. To set the rule for an individual feed, use Virtuoso.setFeedMaxAssets(java.lang.String, int) method.
        Virtuoso will never automatically store more than this number of episodes for a single feed. But certain actions, such as a manual download request from the user, may cause the number of downloaded episodes in a feed to exceed this number.

        Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the settingChanged method in Observers.IEngineObserver. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_SUBSCRIPTIONS_MAX_EPISODES
        Parameters:
        aMax - New maximum value. If this value is <=0 then it will be interpreted as Integer.MAX_VALUE
        Returns:
        The effective settings without the modification having been persisted.
        See Also:
        SubscriptionsService
        setMaxBitrateForSubscriptions 
        abstract ISettings setMaxBitrateForSubscriptions(int aMax)
        Set the default max segmented asset bitrate for feeds.
        ISettings setMaxBitrateForSubscriptions(int aMax)
        Set the default max segmented asset bitrate for feeds.
        This rule is only used with segmented assets. It tells Virtuoso the max bitrate to use when choosing a profile for download.
        To set the maximum bit rate for particular feed, use the Virtuoso.setFeedMaxBitRate(java.lang.String, int) method.

        Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the settingChanged method in Observers.IEngineObserver. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_SUBSCRIPTIONS_MAX_BITRATE
        Parameters:
        aMax - Maximum bit rate
        Returns:
        The effective settings without the modification having been persisted.
        See Also:
        SubscriptionsService

        Returns:
        True if the current setting is to always request permission from the backplane for downloads.

        getAuthenticationErrorAsExternalLock 
        abstract boolean getAuthenticationErrorAsExternalLock()
        Get the current setting for if an HTTP authentication error is marked as an external lock status.
        boolean getAuthenticationErrorAsExternalLock()
        Get the current setting for if an HTTP authentication error is marked as an external lock status.
        Returns:
        true if this state has been set and HTTP 401 results in an external lock status.
        setAuthenticationErrorAsExternalLock 
        abstract ISettings setAuthenticationErrorAsExternalLock(boolean val)
        Sets the engine to consider an HTTP authentication error as a blocking error caused by an external lock.
        ISettings setAuthenticationErrorAsExternalLock(boolean val)
        Sets the engine to consider an HTTP authentication error as a blocking error caused by an external lock. This will result in assets being marked with the status Common.AssetStatus.DOWNLOAD_EXTERNAL_LOCK. Otherwise this HTTP error will be handled as a standard network blocked error.
